Uses of Class
vialab.SMT.Zone

    • Uses of Zone in vialab.SMT

      Subclasses of Zone in vialab.SMT 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ButtonZone
      ButtonZone is a simple button, that when touched calls the press[ButtonName](), or the pressImpl() function if ButtonZone is extended with an overridden pressImpl()
      class  ImageZone
      This is a rectangular zone which displays an image.
      class  KeyboardZone
      KeyboardZone is an implementation of an on-screen keyboard, use this zones addKeyListener(Zone) method to add zones such as TextZone to listen to this keyboard
      class  SliderZone
      SliderZone provides a simple GUI Slider that is designed for touch
      class  TabZone
      TabZone is a container for other Zones, it has tabs along its top, allowing easy switching between different views.
      class  TextZone
      TextZone displays text, and is selectable by touch, each word is independently highlighted by touch, toggled whenever a TouchDown occurs on the word
      Fields in vialab.SMT with type parameters of type Zone 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Zone> Zone.children 
      protected static java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Zone> TouchClient.zoneList
      The main zone list
      Methods in vialab.SMT that return Zone 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Zone[] TouchClient.add(java.lang.String xmlFilename)
      This adds zones by creating them from XML specs, the XML needs "zone" tags, and currently supports the following variables: name, x, y, width, height, img
      Zone Zone.clone()
      Clones the zone and all child zones
      Zone Zone.clone(int cloneMaxChildGenerations)
      Clones the zone and optionally any child zones up to the specified generation of children
      Zone[] TouchClient.getActiveZones() 
      Zone Zone.getChild(int index) 
      Zone[] Zone.getChildren() 
      Zone Zone.getParent() 
      Zone[] TouchClient.getZones()
      Returns the list of zones.
      Methods in vialab.SMT with parameters of type Zone 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void TouchClient.add(Zone... zones)
      Adds a zone to the zone list.
      boolean Zone.add(Zone zone) 
      boolean TabZone.add(Zone zone) 
      boolean TabZone.add(Zone zone, java.lang.String tabName, java.lang.String tabText)
      This adds the Given zone to a tab, with the given tabName and tabText
      void KeyboardZone.addZoneKeyListener(Zone zone)
      This is a convenience method, which only adds Zone's as KeyListener
      void TouchClient.assignTouches(Zone zone, Touch... touches) 
      java.util.Collection<Touch> TouchClient.getTouchesFromZone(Zone zone) 
      static java.lang.reflect.Method SMTUtilities.getZoneMethod(java.lang.String methodPrefix, Zone zone, boolean warnMissing)
      Use this method when creating Classes extending Zone, to acquires a Method which can be called by invoke(Method, Zone)
      void TouchClient.grid(int x, int y, int width, int xSpace, int ySpace, Zone... zones)
      This organizes the given zones into a grid configuration with the given x, y, width, height, and spacing
      static java.lang.Object SMTUtilities.invoke(java.lang.reflect.Method method, Zone zone)
      Invokes the given method of the given Zone
      void Zone.putChildOnTop(Zone zone)
      Changes the ordering of the child zones, placing the given one on top
      void TouchClient.putZoneOnTop(Zone zone) 
      boolean Zone.remove(Zone child) 
      boolean TouchClient.remove(Zone zone)
      This removes the zone given from the TouchClient, meaning it will not be drawn anymore or be assigned touches, but can be added back with a call to add(zone);
      boolean TabZone.remove(Zone zone) 
      void KeyboardZone.removeZoneKeyListener(Zone zone)
      This is a convenience method, which only removes a Zone from being a KeyListener on this keyboard
